p: The spraying method is another conventional technique used to form a semi-permeable membrane on the surface of food products [ 89]. The spraying system distributes the coating solution through the formation of droplets over the targeted food surface area with the help of nozzles [ 172]. The spraying technique needs less amount of coating material to achieve good coverage due to high spraying pressure (approx. 60â€“80 psi) [ 176]. The other advantages of this method are the uniform coating, control of thickness, possibility of multilayer applications, avoidance of coating solution contamination, temperature control of the solution and enabling of working with large surface areas [ 172].
